definition: sugar-coated bullets, term used by Mao (originally in 1949) to refer to corrupting bourgeois influences
to prepare herbal medicine by roasting or parching (in a pan)
to sauté/to fry/to dry by heating
to pluck (a string)/to play (a string instrument)/to spring or leap/to shoot (e.g. with a catapult)/(of cotton) to fluff or tease/to flick/to flip/to accuse/to impeach/elastic (of materials)

sentences.english: Or it can be so sugarcoated that it becomes a meaningless exercise in management.
sentences.chinese: 甚至它會在管理中成爲一顆毫無意義的糖衣炮彈。

sentences.english: It's really like offering poison coated with sugar.
sentences.chinese: 這種行爲真的就像給他們送糖衣炮彈。

sentences.english: When we travel the world of mortals, unavoidably have sugar-coated cannonball, alluring trap.
sentences.chinese: 當我們奔波紅塵時，難免有糖衣炮彈，誘惑的陷阱。

sentences.english: Complete Non-sense and Sugar Coated talk.
sentences.chinese: 簡直是胡說八道和糖衣炮彈。

sentences.english: The bourgeois. e is. sure to corrode people and aim its sugar-coated bullets at them.
sentences.chinese: 資產階級一定要腐蝕人，用糖衣炮彈打人。

sentences.english: Indeed Sugar coated words from chinese side won't change their objectives .
sentences.chinese: 中國人的糖衣炮彈不會改變其目標。

sentences.english: He failed to resist the sugarcoated bullet, and was dragged into crime by hardcore criminals.
sentences.chinese: 抵抗住糖衣炮彈的襲擊，被犯罪分子拉下了水。

sentences.english: A spiritual one hit its target, Po I-po.
sentences.chinese: 精神的糖衣炮彈打中了一個靶子，就是薄一波。

definition: see the opportunity and act (idiom); to act according to circumstances/to play it by ear/to use one's discretion
to patch up one's lie (when inconsistencies appear)/to cover (for sb who has lied)
lit. firing after the horse/fig. belated action/giving advice in hindsight
to get straight to the point (idiom)
to follow the path to one's own doom (idiom)/to bring about one's own destruction
to make a terrible scene (idiom)/to throw a tantrum
pinyin: yi1 ku1 er4 nao4 san1 shang4 diao4

definition: to puff up/to swell up/to inflate/to blow air into sth/(fig.) to encourage/to support
lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
